content: The Amazon River flows through nine countries in South America before emptying into what ocean?

The Amazon River, the mightiest in the world by volume and second longest after the Nile, flows through nine countries in South America. These countries include Peru, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Venezuela, Guyana, Suriname, and France (through its overseas department of French Guiana). After traversing this vast area, the Amazon River finally empties into the Atlantic Ocean. The mouth of the river is characterized by a broad delta where the freshwater mixes with the saltwater of the ocean, creating a unique ecosystem known as an estuary.
